page.title: 08FARMING AROUND RAVENGLASS
page.content: There are 8 farms in the area, most of them owner-occupied.They range in size from{80 - 600}acres. Each is worked by { 2}or{3}people. The land varies from tidal saltmarsh through managed grassland to rough hill grazing.The soil is heavy clay.The type of farming is mainly grassland farming.A survey of{6}of the farms showed that all make hay and silage,and some grow other crops (barley,swedes or potatoes).All farms run herds of beef cattle and 4 have dairy herds Of{40}to{100}head. Sheep are kept at{5}farms,{4}of them keeping breeding flocks.The Herdwick, a hardy local breed,is in evidence amongst the sheep{3}farms keep poultry ({30}to{70}fowl).Ulverston is the most popular market but the market at Broughton and the more distant markets at Cockermouth or Carlisle are used occasionally.
